title: MicroStrategy Announces $4.2B Preferred Stock Sale for Bitcoin Purchases
summary: MicroStrategy will sell up to $4.2B of its 10% Series A Perpetual Preferred Stock through an ATM program, primarily to fund more Bitcoin acquisitions. The company holds 597,325 BTC with $14.05B unrealized gains and plans to raise $84B by 2027 through its '42/42' capital plan.

title: SharpLink Gaming Holds 205K ETH Worth $527M in Treasury
summary: SharpLink Gaming disclosed holdings of 205,634 ETH valued at $527.4M, making it the second-largest ether treasury after Ethereum Foundation. The company bought 7,689 ETH for $19.7M recently and raised $64M through share sales, following a $425M private placement led by Consensys.

title: PumpFun's $600M Token Sale Canceled After Community Backlash
summary: PumpFun planned to sell 150B PUMP tokens for $600M at a $4B valuation on Gate, but pulled the listing after criticism from users expecting an airdrop. The project has already generated $700M in revenue and faces competition from LetsBonk, which has surpassed it in tokens created and revenue.

title: Phantom Wallet Integrates Perpetual Trading via Hyperliquid
summary: Phantom is launching perpetual contract trading directly in its wallet for EU users, powered by Hyperliquid's API with up to 40x leverage. Hyperliquid has processed over $1.57T in perp trading volume and recently raised $150M at a $3B valuation.

title: New Zealand to Ban Crypto ATMs
summary: New Zealand regulatory authorities have announced plans to ban cryptocurrency ATMs across the country. This represents a significant regulatory restriction on crypto access infrastructure in the region.

title: BlackRock's IBIT Surpasses 700,000 BTC in Assets
summary: BlackRock's spot Bitcoin ETF (IBIT) has surpassed 700,000 BTC in assets under management. This milestone demonstrates continued institutional adoption and demand for regulated Bitcoin investment products.

title: Eigen Labs Lays Off 25% of Workforce
summary: Eigen Labs has laid off 25% of its workforce to focus resources on EigenCloud development. The restructuring reflects challenging market conditions and strategic refocusing within the restaking protocol ecosystem.

title: Two Men Charged in $650M Crypto Fraud Scheme
summary: Two individuals have been charged in a $650 million global fraud scheme involving foreign exchange trading and cryptocurrency. The case represents one of the largest crypto-related fraud prosecutions to date.
